result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Obed David Lopez

records.addlTxt: Order for Defendant to View Digital Discovery, signed and filed.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Motion to View Digital Discovery

Defendant Obed David Lopez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian Nelson appeared by video for Obed David Lopez.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Brian Nelson in court, defendant Obed David Lopez not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Victim appeared by zoom.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference date to meet with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Nelson in court, defendant Obed David Lopez not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIMINARY COURT FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Obed David Lopez in court with Attorney Brian Nelson.  Defendant Obed David Lopez in custody.  Elaine Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: DA Investigator G. Carrasco. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with AMS (9/11/1992)
  No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Obed David Lopez in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Obed David Lopez in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Obed David Lopez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
